properties.areaDesc: Wabash, IL; Edwards, IL; White, IL; Posey, IN; Knox, IN; Gallatin, IL; Gibson, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 6:25PM EST until January 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Wabash River...

.High river levels and some lowland flooding will occur along rivers
in central and southern Indiana. River levels may approach those
experienced during recent times in a few areas.

Some lowland flooding continues along the East Fork White River
in Jackson County and along the Wabash River in Tippecanoe county.
The White River was at bankfull levels in much of central Indiana.

Lowland flooding is possible along the Wabash River from Covington to
Hutsonville by Tuesday. Backwater from the East Fork White River will
cause lowland flooding along the Muscatatuck river in southern
Jackson County this weekend.

Rain of one half to three fourths of an inch fell Thursday and
another one half to three fourths of an inch may fall by Tuesday.
This will keep rivers at elevated levels in central Indiana for 6
more days and in southwest Indiana for 10 more days.

High water will close State Road 235 east of Medora in Jackson County
through Tuesday. High water may affect 225 near Battleground and 258
east of Cortland during the weekend.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Wabash River at Mount Carmel.
* until Tuesday afternoon.
* At  4:45 PM Monday the stage was 19.5 feet.
* Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will continue to fall to below flood stage by late
tonight.
* At 20.0 feet...River is bankfull in all locations.  All oil field
production ceases with the exception of pumping units on
substructures.  Access to these are by boat only.  Agricultural
losses increase dramatically.  Farmers move livestock to higher
ground.  City of Mount Carmel leaves flood gates B and C in year
round.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
